headline: 100MW solar-plus-storage site submitted to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: Developer ACE Power and Osaka Gas Energy Australia have submitted plans for a 100MW solar-plus-storage project to Australia’s EPBC Act.

headline: Tindo Solar supplies solar PV modules to Micronesia submarine cable project
summary_80w: Australian module manufacturer Tindo Solar has supplied 70 of its 430W N-Type bifacial Walara solar modules to power data cable landing stations for the East Micronesia Cable System (EMCS) project in the Pacific nations of Nauru and Kiribati.

headline: Victoria the first Australian state to cross 1GW BESS charging milestone
summary_80w: Victoria has become the first state in Australia's National Electricity Market (NEM) to achieve more than 1GW of simultaneous battery storage charging.

headline: JinkoSolar bags federal approval for 1,440MWh solar-plus-storage site in Australia
summary_80w: The Australian government has granted approval for the 1.4GWh Garoo solar-plus-storage project being pursued by Jinko Power Australia.

headline: EU, IEA and IRENA lead open letter calling for a ‘just and equitable energy transition’
summary_80w: Representatives from the EU, IEA and IRENA have signed an open letter to deliver a 'just and equitable energy transition'.

headline: Grid constraints threatening India’s renewable energy targets – report
summary_80w: The development of India’s power transmission network is lagging behind the country’s rapid growth in renewable energy, leading to project delays and cost increases

headline: Solar PV and energy storage can deliver ‘quick wins’ for Europe’s vulnerable grids
summary_80w: European geopolitical tensions have exploited weaknesses in grid systems, leaving 55% of Europe’s grids vulnerable, according to Ember.

headline: Sonnedix acquires 226MW Italian solar portfolio
summary_80w: Spanish IPP Sonnedix has acquired five solar projects in Sicily and Lazio, Italy, with a combined capacity of 226MW.

headline: BESS in Trump 2.0: Does the administration’s rhetoric have to become the industry’s?
summary_80w: During a 10 September panel on communicating renewables through a Conservative lens at the RE+ trade show in Las Vegas, US, participants discussed how to gain support from Republicans for battery energy storage systems (BESS), solar, and more in the wake of the ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ Act

headline: OCI Energy, Nexus Renewable Power secure financing for Texas BESS projects
summary_80w: Two developers, OCI Energy and Nexus Renewable Power have secured financing for battery energy storage system (BESS) projects located in Texas, US.

headline: Lithium-ion dominates first round of UK LDES cap-and-floor scheme
summary_80w: Just over 70% of the successful projects in the first window of the UK's long-duration energy storage (LDES) scheme are using lithium-ion BESS technology.

headline: Ancillary service prices ‘through the roof’ in Baltics, 20-30% IRRs for BESS first-movers
summary_80w: The Baltics is among the most attractive regions in Europe for battery energy storage system (BESS) investment right now, with the recent decoupling from Russia and increasing renewable energy use sending flexibility needs soaring.

headline: Non-lithium energy storage startups Fourth Power, Unbound Potential and XL Batteries raise financing
summary_80w: A trio of energy storage startups: XL Batteries, Unbound Potential and Fourth Power, have raised financing for emerging flow battery and thermal storage technologies.

headline: Australia’s first 8-hour LDES battery energy storage system registered with AEMO
summary_80w: RWE Renewables Australia has successfully registered Australia's first 8-hour duration battery energy storage system (BESS) with the Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO).

headline: Snowy Hydro, BHP sign offtake deals for over 2GWh of battery energy storage in Australia
summary_80w: Two battery storage offtake agreements have been signed in Australia, representing over 2GWh of storage capacity.

headline: Queensland government commits AU$48 million to 5.7GWh pumped hydro plant in Australia
summary_80w: The Queensland government has invested AU$48 million to overhaul the ageing 5.7GWh Wivenhoe Pumped Hydro Power Station in Australia.

headline: Boviet Solar expands North Carolina module manufacturing capacity to 3GW
summary_80w: Boviet Solar has added an additional 1GW of manufacturing capacity to its module manufacturing plant in North Carolina.

headline: European PPA prices fall 0.6% to August, solar remains cornerstone of renewable offtake deals
summary_80w: European power purchase agreement (PPA) prices fell 0.6% between July and August this year, according to Swiss consultancy Pexpark.

headline: Jinko and LONGi end patent lawsuits, agree to ‘cross-licensing agreement’
summary_80w: JinkoSolar and LONGi Green Energy have agreed to terminate ongoing patent lawsuits, and enter into a 'cross-licensing agreement'/

headline: Sunsure commissions 82.5MW solar project in Uttar Pradesh, India
summary_80w: Sunsure Energy has commissioned an 82.5MW solar project in Jhansi, in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh, its tenth project in the state.

headline: Australia’s NEM sets 78.6% renewable energy share record
summary_80w: Australia’s NEM set a new instantaneous renewables share record of 78.6% on 22 September, surpassing the previous day's record of 77.9%.

headline: Capstone, Eurowind file 3.2GWh long-duration BESS project application with California Energy Commission
summary_80w: Capstone-Eurowind 3.2GWh BESS project is the latest to reach the final stage of the California Energy Commission opt-in process.

headline: Capital Power’s first two BESS projects come online in Ontario
summary_80w: Capital Power has announced commercial operations of its 120MW York battery energy storage system (BESS) and 50MW Goreway BESS projects in Ontario, Canada.

headline: The majority of utility-scale batteries were used for arbitrage in 2024 – US EIA survey finds
summary_80w: The US Energy Information Administration (US EIA) annual survey of power plant activity found that in 2024, utility-scale batteries were more commonly used for price arbitrage.

headline: BYD launches 14.5MWh BESS as energy density race continues
summary_80w: BYD has presented its latest grid-scale BESS product, pushing energy density even further to its limits, while Eve and Sunwoda have progressed commercialisation of high capacity battery cells.

headline: Poland’s PGE starts building 981MWh BESS with locally manufactured LG batteries
summary_80w: Power firm PGE has started building a 262MW/981MWh BESS in Poland with LG batteries, coinciding with Solar Media's Energy Storage Summit CEE, which kicked off today (23 September).

headline: Australia raises 2035 emissions reduction target to 62-70%
summary_80w: Australia’s Prime Minister, Anthony Albanese, has increased the country’s emissions reduction target for 2035 to a range of 62% to 70%.

headline: Approval granted for 4.9GWh of battery energy storage by developers in Victoria, Australia
summary_80w: Victoria, Australia, has seen just under 5GWh of battery energy storage systems (BESS) granted approval for development by the state and federal governments.

headline: Now is the time for interconnection reform
summary_80w: IREC’s Vaughan Woodruff considers the critical need for state-level reforms in readiness for the next shift in federal policy.

headline: Fluence supplying largest BESS to enter Poland’s capacity market in 2027, for Ukrainian IPP DTEK
summary_80w: Fluence has deepened its partnership with Ukraine-headquartered energy company DTEK, agreeing to supply a large-scale battery storage project in Poland.

headline: Inside the race to PV cell quality and compliance
summary_80w: Kiwa PI Berlin examines the importance of doing cell-level diligence to manage quality of n-type modules such as TOPCon and HJT.

headline: Nigeria to build 1GW solar module manufacturing facility
summary_80w: The Rural Electrification Agency (REA) of Nigeria has announced plans to build a 1GW solar module manufacturing facility in the country.

headline: Brookfield, Solarvest to develop 1.5GW solar PV and BESS portfolio in Malaysia
summary_80w: Global investment firm Brookfield has entered into a joint investment framework agreement with Malaysian developer Solarvest to build a 1.5GW utility-scale solar and BESS portfolio in Malaysia.

headline: E2: Solar accounts for more than 60% of all jobs in US renewable energy generation
summary_80w: The US added 6,012 new jobs in the solar industry between the fourth quarter of 2023 and the fourth quarter of 2024, according to E2.

headline: The Netherlands ceases SolarNL manufacturing programme
summary_80w: The Dutch government has decided to discontinue the funding of SolarNL, a domestic solar manufacturing programme.

headline: GridStor, Flatiron Energy, and Jupiter Power advance US BESS projects totalling 1.6GWh
summary_80w: Three US battery energy storage system (BESS) developers, GridStor, Flatiron, and Jupiter Power, have advanced BESS projects totalling 1.6GWh across Arizona, Massachusetts, and Michigan.

headline: North American virtual power plants added 4.5GW of new capacity in 2024: Wood Mackenzie
summary_80w: The capacity of virtual power plants in North America has reached 37.5GW, a 13.7% year-on-year growth, according to Wood Mackenzie.

headline: LDES could have ‘real market-moving impacts’ on price spreads and other UK flexibility assets
summary_80w: Projects supported by the UK government's long-duration energy storage (LDES) cap-and-floor could significantly dampen price spreads but also affect non-LDES flexibility assets.

headline: Startup Green Gravity to trial gravitational energy storage at a former coal mine in Australia
summary_80w: Green Gravity has signed an agreement with mining company Wollongong Resources to trial its gravitational energy storage in NSW, Australia.

headline: AGL, Someva receive approval for 2GWh wind-plus-storage site in New South Wales, Australia
summary_80w: Someva Renewables and AGL Energy have received the federal greenlight to develop a 2GWh wind-plus-storage project in NSW, Australia.

headline: Lightsource bp begins work on co-located BESS at 585MWdc solar PV plant in Australia
summary_80w: Lightsource bp has commenced work on a co-located battery energy storage system (BESS) at a 585MWdc solar PV plant in Australia.

headline: Avathon launches autonomous AI managing platform for renewables
summary_80w: Artificial intelligence (AI) company Avathon has launched its AI-powered Autonomy Platform to boost profitability in a market that is facing tax and policy challenges.

headline: Repsol starts commercial operations at 629MW solar PV plant in Texas

headline: EdgeMode to build 300MW/1.2GWh solar-plus-storage portfolio for Spanish data centres
summary_80w: EdgeMode has acquired a portfolio of data centre assets in Spain, with plans to build a 300MW solar, 1.2GWh storage facility at the sites.

headline: Strategies for managing ageing solar assets
summary_80w: Marco Zaniboni and Juanma Fernandez of Sonnedix examine the key considerations in deciding whether to revamp, repower or retrofit.

headline: Solar Stewardship Initiative adopts new transparency targets for modules exported to European countries
summary_80w: The Solar Stewardship Initiative (SSI) has adopted a new set of binding targets and reporting requirements for its PV manufacturing members.

headline: Australia sets 62-70% emissions reduction target for 2035
summary_80w: Australia has committed to cutting greenhouse gas emissions by 62-70% below 2005 levels by 2035, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese announced on Thursday (18 September).

headline: Dominion receives approval to develop 400MWh BESS in Virginia after fire safety concerns alleviated
summary_80w: Regulated utility Dominion Energy last week received the green light from local officials to develop a 100MW/400MWh BESS in Fauquier County, Virginia.

headline: Italy: IPP orders 220MWh from Sungrow as MACSE approaches
summary_80w: IPP EP Produzione has ordered 220MWh of BESS from inverter and energy storage firm Sungrow in Italy, with a storage-focused capacity auction scheme just 11 days away.

headline: Soaring energy storage orders, robust financial performance drive up Chinese ESS cell prices
summary_80w: Several Chinese companies active in the energy storage space have recently released their financial reports for H1 2025, with the majority posting strong growth. Their energy storage business segments have been a key driver of that growth.

headline: Lightsource bp kicks off construction on CIS contract-winning solar-plus-storage plant in Australia
summary_80w: Developer Lightsource bp has commenced construction on a 49MW/562MWh BESS co-located at the 585MWdc Goulburn River solar plant in Australia.

headline: CERC to finalise virtual PPA guidelines to boost 40GW of renewable capacity
summary_80w: CERC is finalising guidelines for virtual power purchase agreements (vPPAs) to unlock financing for over 40GW of uncontracted renewable capacity.

headline: North American VPP capacity grows 13.7% as market ‘broadened more than deepened’
summary_80w: The capacity of virtual power plants in operation in North America has reached 37.5GW, a 13.7% year-on-year growth, according to Wood Mackenzie.

headline: Canada forecast to add up to 26GW of solar PV by 2035
summary_80w: The Canadian Renewable Energy Association (CanREA) has forecast that Canada will add between 17GW and 26GW of solar PV over the next decade.

headline: NREL study reveals high UV degradation in n-type modules

headline: India’s solar manufacturers applaud ALMM proposal to boost domestic wafer production
summary_80w: Indian PV makers have welcomed the government’s plan to add solar wafers to its ALMM List-III from June 2028.

headline: How Canada is driving 8-12GW of storage deployments by 2035 – ESC report
summary_80w: In a recent report from trade association Energy Storage Canada (ESC), energy storage was cited as “a critical component of future electricity grids” for the country.

headline: National Fire Protection Association releases NFPA 855 ESS safety standard, 2026 edition

headline: When quality slips through the cracks: A procurement guide to hidden BESS risks
summary_80w: Jeff Zwijack, associate director of energy storage at Clean Energy Associates, writes that BESS projects depend on the reliability of fully integrated systems, not just high-quality battery cells.

headline: Re.venture, Green Flexibility, EWE progress Germany BESS projects, Terra One raises €150 million
summary_80w: A flurry of BESS project deployment news in Germany from Re.venture, Green Flexibility, EWE and Terra One, with the projects designed to relieve grid congestion and one configured for a 4-hour duration.

headline: ‘Vertical integration to the dirt in the ground’: Invinity hunts flow battery supply chain, manufacturing advantage
summary_80w: ESN Premium speaks to Matt Harper, president of flow battery company Invinity Energy Systems, about pursuing a competitive advantage in an emerging space.

headline: Tesla issues Powerwall 2 product recall in Australia following cases of fires
summary_80w: Tesla has issued a product recall on its Powerwall 2 residential battery storage solution across Australia due to a “battery cell defect” from a third-party supplier.

headline: South Korea: ‘Companies have no model to recover their investment in DC energy storage’
summary_80w: Chang Jae Won of the Korea Smart Grid Association believes companies lack a model for recovering their investment in DC energy storage.

headline: Advanced compressed air energy storage: Hydrostor secures US$55 million for 1.6GWh Australia project
summary_80w: Hydrostor has secured US$55 million in funding from Export Development Canada (EDC) to advance development activities for its 200MW/1,600MWh Silver City Energy Storage Centre project in Broken Hill, New South Wales, Australia.

headline: Longroad reaches financial close for 400MW Texas solar project

headline: Self-consumption keeps falling in Spain, sector adds 611MW in H1 2025

headline: Trina Solar sees 1GWh BESS fast-tracked in Australia’s Victoria

headline: Acciona Energia commissions 412MWp PV plant in India

headline: Velto acquires 260MW operational solar portfolio in Spain
summary_80w: Spanish IPP Velto Renewables has acquired a portfolio of 53 operational solar assets in Spain with a combined capacity of 260MW.

headline: Meyer Burger unlikely to survive under provisional debt moratorium
summary_80w: Struggling Swiss solar manufacturer Meyer Burger has formally entered into a debt moratorium, with the possibility of rescuing the entire group now looking unlikely.

headline: Nexamp secures US$350 million financing from Macquarie
summary_80w: Nexamp has secured US$350 million through a long-term financing facility to expand its 6GW utility-scale solar and battery storage pipeline in the US.

headline: DAS Solar plans 5GW XBC cell plant as technology shifts to TOPCon/back contact combination
summary_80w: Chinese module producer DAS Solar is planning a 5GW manufacturing facility focused on producing high-efficiency back contact cells.

headline: California passes bills to reduce energy prices, ‘applauded’ by SEIA and CEBA
summary_80w: The California State Legislature has passed two bills that aim to reduce energy prices in the state, AB 825 and SB 302.

headline: QatarEnergy, Samsung C&T ink EPC contract for 2GW solar PV project in Qatar
summary_80w: QatarEnergy has signed an EPC agreement with Samsung C&T for its 2GW Dukhan project.

headline: Time for US solar to take off the training wheels
summary_80w: PV CellTech: Martin Pochtaruk, CEO of North American solar module manufacturer Heliene, says US producers must learn to survive without tax incentives.

headline: Samsung SDI to start US BESS manufacturing from 2026
summary_80w: South Korean battery and electronics materials manufacturer Samsung SDI debuted its new battery energy storage system (BESS) products at the RE+ trade show in Las Vegas, US.

headline: Arkansas utility seeks approval of 1.4GWh hybrid BESS, with financial support from Google as part of data centre deal
summary_80w: Investor-owned utility (IOU) Entergy is seeking regulatory approval from the Arkansas Public Service Commission (PSC) to construct what could become the largest BESS in the southern US State. It will support a data centre from Google.

headline: Sympower and Suena raise combined €27 million for European BESS optimisation, international expansion
summary_80w: Europe-based BESS optimisation and flexibility providers Sympower and Suena have completed Series B1 and A fundraisings respectively.

headline: China aims for energy storage installations equivalent to today’s global capacity by 2027
summary_80w: China has published a national plan to promote large-scale energy storage facilities, encouraging investment and broader participation in the electricity market.

headline: Over 15GWh of energy storage successful in Australia’s Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 3
summary_80w: Australia's Capacity Investment Scheme (CIS) has awarded 4.13GW/15.37GWh of battery storage capacity in its third tender round, exceeding initial targets and attracting 135GWh of bids.

headline: RE+ 2025: US solar industry calls for resilience amid policy challenges
summary_80w: At RE+, industry leaders pointed to the resilience of the US solar sector, despite challenges brought by the 'One Big, Beautiful Bill' Act.

headline: European solar leaders ask EU policymakers for more manufacturing support
summary_80w: Two of the major European solar trade associations, the European Solar Manufacturing Council (ESMC) and SolarPower Europe (SPE), have called for EU policymakers to take measures supporting European solar manufacturing.

headline: Chinese BESS players still hope to supply US in FEOC policy environment
summary_80w: Chinese energy storage companies active in the US face an uncertain future as federal policies encourage moves to reduce their supply chain involvement.

headline: Sunotec launches Nordic unit to drive solar and hybrid projects
summary_80w: Sunotec has launched Sunotec Nordic to spearhead solar and hybrid renewable project development across the Nordic region.

headline: Saudi Arabia launches tender for 5.3GW of renewables, 3.1GW of solar
summary_80w: The SPPC has launched a request for qualifications for 5.3GW of new renewable power capacity, of which solar will account for 3.1GW.

headline: GCL Tech secures $700 Million investment from Middle Eastern capital
summary_80w: Chinese polysilicon producer GCL-Tech has entered into a strategic financing agreement with Infini Capital, a globally renowned investment institution backed by a Middle Eastern sovereign wealth fund.

headline: IB Solar to build 4GW TOPCon cell and module plant in India
summary_80w: IB Solar is investing INR30 billion (US$340 million) in a 4GW TOPCon solar cell and module manufacturing plant in Jewar, Uttar Pradesh.

headline: Philippines commissions country’s first agriPV-plus-storage project
summary_80w: The Philippines has commissioned the Batangas 1 project, the country's first to combine agriPV with a battery energy storage system (BESS).

headline: Wisconsin Republicans propose bill to improve access to community solar projects
summary_80w: Two Wisconsin Republicans have introduced legislation to open access to community solar projects in the US state.

headline: Turbo Energy secures 336MWh C&I battery storage order in Spain
summary_80w: Residential and C&I energy storage provider Turbo Energy has secured a major order from an unnamed industrial group in the construction industry in Spain.

headline: Explosion test ‘demonstrates effectiveness’ of BESS safety control system, Wärtsilä says
summary_80w: A proprietary explosion control system performed effectively in three recent safety tests conducted on Wärtsilä battery storage equipment.

headline: Ignitis orders 582MWh from Rolls-Royce, Olana takes FID on Lithuania BESS projects
summary_80w: Ignitis Group and Olana Energy have progressed BESS projects in Lithuania closer to construction, with the order of equipment and final investment decision (FID) taken, respectively.

headline: ‘Power even without the sun’: President Marcos Jr inaugurates first ‘solar baseload’ power plant in Philippines
summary_80w: President of the Philippines, Ferdinand Marcos Jr., was in attendance as the country’s first 'baseload' power plant to combine solar PV and battery storage officially went into action.

headline: Fixing the renewable energy data mess
summary_80w: Advances in edge-based artificial intelligence are helping make solar and storage interoperable by tackling the data challenge, writes Andrew Foster.

headline: Italy receives 10GW of solar PV bids in FER X auction, opens second auction
summary_80w: Italy’s latest renewable energy tender has received 12GW of bids, of which the majority, 10GW, came from solar PV.

headline: Sunrun raises US$510 million in securitisation
summary_80w: Sunrun has priced a securitisation of leases and power purchase agreements, taking its non-recourse debt capital raised in Q3 above US$1.5 billion.

headline: Axpo, energieUri and Fluence building 58.6MW of Swiss BESS
summary_80w: Utility and power firms Axpo and energieUri will together deploy two BESS projects in Switzerland with technology provided by system integrator Fluence.

headline: 12.5GWh of grid-scale BESS commissioned in August, including largest single-phase LFP project ever
summary_80w: China again dominated global battery storage deployments in August, accounting for two-thirds of what came online, but Europe, North America and Oceania/Australia had good months too.

headline: Hithium, Fotowatio Renewable Ventures partner for first time with 500MWh grid-forming BESS in Australia
summary_80w: Hithium will supply battery storage and SMA the power conversion systems for a 500MWh grid-forming project in Australia for Fotowatio Renewable Ventures (FRV).

headline: NY local town officials call on moratorium to suspend 1GWh BESS, State representatives issue support for project
summary_80w: The Town of Ulster in New York has received a request from local officials of the neighbouring town of Hurley to temporarily suspend the permitting process of a 250MW/1,000MWh BESS project under development by independent power producer (IPP) Terra-Gen.
